scenario_name: Flap System Fault due to Position Sensor Failure
description: During initial approach, a faulty flap position sensor on the right wing sends conflicting data to the flight computers (SFCC). While the flaps extend physically, the system logic detects a discrepancy, flags a fault, and prevents further flap extension.

telemetry_events.description: When flap lever is moved from CONF 0 to CONF 1, a sensor on the right flap fails to report the movement.

maintenance_logs.report: PIREP: Intermittent F/CTL FLAP SYS 2 FAULT warning appeared while parked at the gate, then cleared on its own.
maintenance_logs.action: SFCC 2 BITE test performed, no stored faults found. System reset. Aircraft released for service.

transcript.sound: ECAM warning chime (no unusual mechanical sounds).

transcript.speaker: PM
transcript.dialogue: We have an ECAM... Flight Controls... Flap System 2 Fault.

transcript.speaker: PF
transcript.dialogue: Okay, let's see. The flaps appear to be out. E/WD shows flaps at 1. Status page?

transcript.speaker: PM
transcript.dialogue: Status page confirms. We have a fault, but flaps are extended to CONF 1. We'll need to advise ATC of a non-normal configuration.

context_data.atc_communication: [Callsign], be advised we have a minor flight control issue and will be landing with a non-normal flap configuration. Requesting a slightly longer final approach, no emergency declared at this time.
